programme.desc: An aerial journey to the remote fjiords and valleys of eastern Iceland.

programme.title: Relaxing Orchid Garden
programme.desc: Flowers swaying in the breeze.

programme.title: Tumpak Sewu Waterfalls: East Java
programme.desc: A close look at the edge of the tiered, plunging streams of Indonesia's Tumpak Sewu falls.

programme.title: Flying Over Greece
programme.desc: Journey through the landscapes of Greece from a bird's-eye-view.

programme.title: Hawaii Sunrise Waves
programme.desc: Filmed along the eastern shores of Oahu, Hawaii; waves crash and glisten as the golden sun casts its warming rays.

programme.title: Rainbow Reef Relaxation 1
programme.desc: Vibrant underwater reefs, including many scenes which no longer look as depicted due to coral bleaching.

programme.title: Beach Paradise: Hawaii
programme.desc: Spending a restful moment in Maui, a tropical paradise of gleaming white sand beaches and turquoise waters.

programme.title: Crashing Waves: Hawaii
programme.desc: The energizing sound of waves crashing on the shores of Hawaii's Red Sand Beach.

programme.title: Bryce Canyon Relaxation
programme.desc: Admiring the wonders of one of the world's most breathtaking natural destinations: Bryce Canyon, in Utah.

programme.title: Hidden Tropical Paradise 2
programme.desc: Taveuni and Small Outer Islands of Fiji.

programme.title: Pantai Ngopet: Indonesia
programme.desc: Discover the awe-inspiring waters of Indonesia with a tour of various vacation-worthy spots.

programme.title: Glacial Beauty: Newfoundland
programme.desc: Admiring the quiet and glacial beauty of icebergs drifting across the bay at Newfoundland's Amherst Cove.

programme.title: Forest in the Sea
programme.desc: Explore the kelp forest off the California coast, that supports more than 100,000 creatures.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Summer Shiels gets to know Goa through experiences like shipwreck diving, finding deserted beaches and meeting an artist inspired by the state.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: The food, the beers, the chocolate and the fries. Bruges is one of the cities that seemed to have skipped 21st century altogether.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Off The Grid Tsomoriri, India
programme.desc: Alexandra starts her journey from Tsomoriri where on the way she stops at Baralacha Pass. Later she visits Korzok village, interacts with locals and dresses up in a traditional Ladakhi attire.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E54 Bucket List Fukuoka, Japan
programme.desc: While the rest of Japan remained isolated from the world, Fukuoka’s global flavour was concocted by centuries of trade with its Asian neighbours. Adventurers, Daniel Coll and Paddy Doherty attend a unique baseball game at a rather offbeat stadium in Kyushu’s largest city.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Food Fact Fun Quebec, Canada
programme.desc: From the famous deer meat pie of Aux Ancies Canadiens to the art on Rue Du Tresor, Alex Drobin soaks in the vibes of sophisticated yet playful Quebec.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s adventures in Perth kick off with him immersing himself in the historic grandeur of the Scone Castle, where a mysterious stone tells tales of Scottish monarchs. But the real thunder of the Highlands awaits at the Braemar Games gathering, where tartan meets brawn, and Robbie learns that embracing his Scottish side involves more than just kilts and castles.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Sommer wraps her stay in Goa with some shopping and heads to Badami. Take a journey back in time to the Bhootnath temple dedicated to God of spirit.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Market square of Bruges is lined up with restaurants and cafes. The city is also home to golden fries or french fries, but are originated in Belgium.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Off The Grid Leh. India
programme.desc: Alexandra explores the rugged region of Leh, visiting Thiksey Monastery, Leh Palace and Shanti Stupa. Later she sets out for a five hour drive to the picturesque Pangong Lake and stays in the tent.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Bucket List Itoshima, Japan
programme.desc: Why do men camp in the great outdoors? Simply to get some peace and quiet. In this episode, watch Dan & Paddy’s day in Itoshima - a place with soothing waterfalls, fishing pools and perfect beach sunsets to calm the soul.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Food Fact Fun Toronto, Canada
programme.desc: Alex Drobin gets to know the vibe of Toronto at significant spots such as Saint Lauren’s Market and Sir Henry’s Garage for Classic Cars.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 World Spas Maya Ubud, Indonesia
programme.desc: At Maya Ubud Spa Resort, Jamie Srubis tries different spa treatments that induce the same tranquility which Bali does.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Off The Grid Nubra valley, India
programme.desc: A 106 feet Buddha statue mesmerizes Alex as she explores Diskit Monastery in Nubra Valley. She tries the traditional ladakhi food and explores Leh city, by visiting Gurdwara Pathar Sahib and a school.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Bucket List Gyokuro, Japan
programme.desc: Tea in Japan is a spiritual concept. Attaching ritual and ceremony to it, this country transforms the act of drinking tea to a moment of communion with the universe. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty find out different ways to relish Gyokuro tea, one of the highest grades of tea available in Japan. They also visit the village where it is grown.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Food Fact Fun Niagara, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts in Niagara with a 5 course meal along with enjoying dance performances near the Niagara falls. Next, exploring the urban space, he visits the Skylon town for a stunning view of the city. Further he visits the Niagara-on-the-lake village and explores its surroundings. He then interacts with a wine expert to learn more about the regional wines. Lastly, Alex is seen exploring the Niagara falls by helicopter, the a tunnel that takes him to the observation desk and then by ferry.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Sommer concludes her Hampi stay as she visits Vithala temple and Lotus Mahal.Further travels to Kabini to explore Kabini and Nagarhole National Parks.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: Antwerp has grown on the banks of the Scheldt River that alongwith the Meuse and the Rhine forms the biggest estuary in western Europe.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Off The Grid Kargil, India
programme.desc: Alexandra explores Kargil, where she is invited for breakfast by the owner of a resort where she is putting up and understands the influence of the cultures on the locals.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Bucket List Ohana, Japan
programme.desc: Among Japan’s best kept secrets is its very own Venice with an oriental flavour to it. Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty visit this hidden gem, and learn a little about Kyushu’s history and Samurai, the legendary Japanese warriors. They also witness an enchanting garden, that is the perfect combination of the creativity of nature and human beings.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Food Fact Fun Vancouver, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts his Vancouver exploration by visiting Bridges restaurant where he tries smoked salmon pizza with some seafood. Then he visits the Richmond Night Market and then Treasure Cafe. Later visits the Steel Toad Brewery in Olympic Village. Next he explores the Gastown, including the steam clock. Further he explores the Hills Native Art ending with Vancouver observation deck. Next he rides on board the Grouse Mountain Skyride, ending with Capilano Suspension Bridge park.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Backpack Kozhikode & Alleppey, India
programme.desc: Summer Shiels gets a glimpse into the traditions, culture and beliefs of Alleppey during a stay on a houseboat.

programme.title: Xplore Belgium
programme.desc: No matter where you look, you will see impressive, interesting architecture that will catch your eye. Until 1550 Ghent was one of the largest cities.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Off The Grid Suru Valley, India
programme.desc: Alex explores Munshi Aziz Bhat Museum displaying the lives of the people, influenced by the traders and travels further on the way to Srinagar. She admires the beauty of Mt. Kun and Nun Kun glacier.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Bucket List Qura, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll and Paddy Doherty pay a visit to the award-winning swordsmith, Matsunaga Genrokuro in the city of Arao in Kyushu, Japan. He shows them a few things about making the swords used by the Samurai, and how to wield them. They also explore some hidden Christian sites in the Nagasaki region.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Food Fact Fun Vancouver Island, Canada
programme.desc: Alex is in Vancouver Island and calls for Saffron salmon at Modern Cafe. Next he visits “Red fish blue fish” a fish and chip shop and tries freshly prepared seafood. Further explores the Parksville beach for its sand sculptures and then explores a 50 year old Symphony Winery. Further Alex visits “Eagle wing whale watching” for fun and knowledge about the ocean life. To add to the adventure rush he tries motocross and then snorkels in cold waters of Nanaimo.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Off The Grid Zanskar, India
programme.desc: On reaching Zanskar, Alex visits Karsha Monastery, the largest one in Zanskar. She ends her stay after exploring the Sani Kanika Monastery, built in 17th century and the stupa.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Sommer recalls her experience of her stay on houseboat. Watch as she learns about Malayalee food culture.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Food Fact Fun Whistler, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts with Kangaroo meat pie in Whistler with a Australian ginger beer and continuing his food trail he visits Earls kitchen for a tuna dish. He then tries out e-biking and travels in the world’s highest cable car joining Blackcomb with Whistler mountain. Next, he visits Squamish lil’wat cultural center to learn about the Aboriginal people. Finally, he takes a tour of Pemberton valley on a horse, tries Canada’s highest zipline and bungee jumps over the Cheakamus river.

programme.title: Off The Grid
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Off The Grid Srinagar, India
programme.desc: Alex is in Srinagar putting up on a houseboat. She explores the Dal lake, tries Kashmiri Tea, and ends her day with a traditional Kashmiri platter – Wazwan.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 City Breaks Munich, Germany
programme.desc: Often called Germany's most livable city, Munich is also one of its most historic, artistic, and entertaining cities. Until 1871, it was the capital of an independent Bavaria. Kristina Guberman admires the elegance of the city through its attractions such as the Gothic city palace, Residenz, the popular Marienplatz square and the stylish BMW Museum.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Backpack Ahmedabad & Gir, India
programme.desc: Sommer explores the bustling city of Ahmedabad and later visits the contrastingly tranquil, Sabarmati ashram, the home of Mahatma Gandhi.

programme.title: Bucket List
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Bucket List Kagoshima, Japan
programme.desc: Daniel Coll & Paddy Doherty visit Meiji-Gura in Kyushu, Japan, to taste a locally brewed Japanese hard liquor, Shochu. They also go to the Makurazaki region for a special meal of bonito, a Japanese seafood delicacy, prepared for them by world-class chefs, Gaggan Anand and Takeshi “Goh” Fukuyama.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Boarding Pass Santa Village, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Santa Village at Rovaniemi, where she reads some of the letters that children from around the world write to him.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Benafsha embarks on a whirlwind adventure in Ahmedabad. With just 48 hours in the city, she is determined to make the most of it, but how?

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Food Fact Fun The Hague, Netherlands
programme.desc: From exploring a vintage car museum to scaling a 5 meter ice-wall and sampling a rich bread cookie, Watch Alex exploring The Hague, also known as the “International city of peace”.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: A modern European oil city built on the back of a rich maritime heritage, Aberdeen is the energetic kingpin of northeast Scotland. While the boom times may come and go, the dynamic coastal metropolis never ceases to thrill with its free museums, outdoor adventures and natural attractions right on the city’s doorstep.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Požarevac and visits the ancient town of Viminacium. Later visits National Museum, concluding with Majdanpek’s Rajkova Pecina Caves.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Boarding Pass Rovaniemi, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline Nsingi Nkosi goes to Rovaniemi, where she visits a husky farm and finds out about about breeding and raising huskies.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 1(Eng)
programme.desc: From lazing in hammocks by the beach to sipping drinks on a private yacht, Kim realizes that Maldives is the perfect destination to unwind in style.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Food Fact Fun Rotterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying dishes like Stroopwafel and Palat Stoofvlees to visiting the Erasmus bridge, cube houses and wall painting on the streets, Alex explores Rotterdam.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Since medieval times Aberdeenshire and its northwestern neighbour Moray have been the richest and most fertile regions of the Highlands. Aberdeenshire is famed for its Aberdeen Angus beef cattle, its many fine castles and the prosperous 'granite city' of Aberdeen.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Explore Majdanpek with our host as the city brings the viewers closer to the treasures strewn across the Serbian countryside.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Boarding Pass Levi, Finland
programme.desc: Levi is Finland's largest and fastest-growing ski destination. Emeline is here, to find out the exciting activities that Levi offers, in summer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: With snow-capped peaks rising over primeval forests and traditional villages, Paro is like an Oriental Switzerland. On a visit to Paro, Radhika explores famous monasteries such as the Rinpung Dzong and Takstang Monastery, and learns the history and legends associated with them. Along the way, she finds out the secrets to the quintessential Bhutanese peace and contentment.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Great World Hotels, Four Seasons 2(Eng)
programme.desc: An invigorating spa treatment, a cooking lesson, a snorkeling session – Kim has experiences in the Maldives that leave her completely rejuvenated.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 Food Fact Fun Utrecht, Netherlands
programme.desc: From trying Orange zest beer and traditional Dutch dishes to exploring St.Martin's Cathedral, Dom Tower and enjoying go karting and stand up paddle boat ride, watch Alex enjoy his trip in Utrecht.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: In the enchanting landscapes of Inverness, Robbie’s journey takes a whimsical turn: from eccentric to downright magical.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: Heather explores Nis,one of the oldest cities in Europe.She visits a concentration camp and later paraglides to end by watching a musical performance.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Boarding Pass Ruka Kuusamo, Finland
programme.desc: Emeline goes to Ruka-Kuusamo, where she tries river rafting. She also meets a reindeer herder,who tells her about the unique ways of herding reindeer.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Actress and travel enthusiast, Radhika Bangia explores the enigma that is Bhutan, when she visits Thimpu, the capital city with no traffic lights and no skyscrapers invading the skyline. Here, she checks out significant sights such as the Tibetan-style National Memorial Chorten, the National Library and the Folk Heritage Museum in order to understand more about the beliefs, history, architecture and cuisine of Bhutan.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 World Heritage Ancient Temples of Egypt, Egypt (ENG)
programme.desc: Explore the ancient heritage sites of Abu Simbel, the Philae complex of Nubia and the Hatshepsut Temple to unravel the mystical stories behind the ancient temples of Egypt.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Food Fact Fun Gouda, Netherlands
programme.desc: Alex tries traditional Dutch food in Leiden, learns about Dutch history at Prinsenhof Museum, visits a Gothic church, a local cheese market and Delftware factory at Gouda.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 10 Days Scotland Isle Of Skye (ENG)
programme.desc: The grand finale of Robbie’s wild homecoming unfolds amidst the rugged beauty of the Isle of Skye.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E31 Backpack Resavsk Pecina, Serbia
programme.desc: Continue exploring Serbia with Heather as she visits the Manasija monastery, Resavska caves, ending with a joyride onboard Eight of Sargan rail line.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 With Love From Mauritius Ep 1
programme.desc: Krisann and Nathan’s vacation in Mauritius begins in Le Morne, where an unexpected adventure awaits the latter.

programme.title: Xplore Bhutan
programme.desc: Known as Druk Yul or the “Land of the Thunder Dragon”, Bhutan is the country of mountains, monasteries and mystery. Radhika Bangia finds this to be true when she visits Punakha, the former capital of Bhutan, where she marvels at the architecture of Punakha Dzong and gets to know the story behind the two rivers, Mo Chhu and Po Chhu. She also explores the sacred temples and Mebar Tsho lake of Bumthang, the religious heart of Bhutan, and gets to know the local legends.

programme.title: World Spas
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 World Spas Kempenki, Jordan (ENG)
programme.desc: Jamie Srubis tries out spa treatments, which are inspired by the Dead Sea and the desert surroundings at Hotel Kempinski Ishtar in Jordan.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Food Fact Fun Dubai 1
programme.desc: After Burj Khalifa, Alex has a traditional Emirati platter, visits the gold market and skiing rink, and goes for a camel safari and camping.

programme.title: City break
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 City Breaks Innsbruck, Austria
programme.desc: Nestled in the mighty Alps, tour the Austrian city of Innsbruck with Sabrina and explore a town that’s alpine-urban yet traditional in nature.

programme.title: Backpack Serbia
programme.desc: In her final leg of journey, Heather visits the Uvac canyon, tries locally prepared pie, ending with Kopaonik National Park and Jelovarnik waterfalls.

programme.title: With Love From Mauritius
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 With Love From Mauritius Ep 2
programme.desc: On an island-hopping adventure in Mauritius, Krisann and Nathan find out that time works differently on these islands.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E26 XP Guide Copenhagen, Denmark
programme.desc: A homely place where the aroma of freshly baked bread greets you as people smoothly glide along on their bicycles. Welcome to Copenhagen.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Unwind Hotel Oriole, Sri Lanka
programme.desc: Indeya explores the Cinnamon plantations, tries a local dish and witnesses a traditional dance performance.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Food Fact Fun Dubai 2
programme.desc: Alex has varied experiences in Dubai like trying Lebanese cheese bread, visiting a coffee museum, going to IMG Worlds of Adventure and more.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Food Fact Fun Amsterdam, Netherlands
programme.desc: In Amsterdam, Alex tries Bitterballen, cannabis cake and visits Heineken Experience brewery. He explores Zaanse Schans village with windmills and Coster Diamonds, the oldest diamond polishing factory.

programme.title: 10 Days Scotland
programme.desc: Robbie’s journey to reconnect with his Scottish roots begins in Edinburgh, the stunning capital city perched on extinct volcanoes. Navigating the twists of the Royal Mile, strutting around the majestic Edinburgh castle and learning to sip scotch like a true Scotsman, he feels a tad closer to his heritage. The real fun kicks in, however, when he stumbles onto a rather flamboyant way to unleash his inner Highlander.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Too Fast To Race
programme.desc: By the early 1980s the 'Group B’ class had become the ‘Godzilla’ of the rally scene. The legacy of Group B, however, is a whole range of spectacular cars that continue to thrill enthusiasts. We look at some of the giants of the class.

programme.title: Nigel Mansell: Il Leone
programme.desc: In this exclusive interview with Peter Windsor, Nigel talks about his career, his life and what drives him to the edge of everything that matters.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 2
programme.desc: The bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal’s longest stage, a 655 km route from Grândola to Badajoz, delivered high drama on Thursday. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders edged Tosha Schareina in RallyGP, while teammate Edgar Canet extended his Rally2 lead. France’s Thomas Zoldos (Rally3) and Gaëtan Martinez (quads) dominated their classes, and João Ferreira (Toyota) claimed a breakthrough Ultimate win over mentor Carlos Sainz. Dacia endured setbacks as Nasser Al-Attiyah and Sébastien Loeb lost significant time. Portugal celebrated a historic triple in FIA categories with Ferreira, Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger), and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 3 will cover 511 km around Badajoz on Friday.

programme.title: Volkswagen ID.R - A year of electric records
programme.desc: It was an exciting year for the Volkswagen ID.R team and Romain Dumas. From the Goodwood festival of Speed to the Tianmen Mountain, no record was left unbroken, watch the action unfold in the official documentary.

programme.title: Leclerc Looks Back at Highlights from his F1 Career
programme.desc: Charles Leclerc has had some huge moments in his career, from spectacular wins to helping the team develop even before he raced for Ferrari's F1 team. We sat down with Leclerc and brought him 5 photos from his career, asking him to pinpoint where he was and why each photo is so special to him.

programme.title: Episode 1: £500 Bike Challenge
programme.desc: In the first episode we have part one of the Motorcycle Olympics where each presenter has £500 to spend on a Motorbike and complete a range of tasks, if they can even get them started. Graham tests the Livewire, an electric bike from Harley Davison and who better to join him then the man who has ridden more mile on one then anyone else in the world, Charley Boorman. To finish off the episodes Bruce get’s his hands on the MV Agusta Rush and falls in love with the sound.

programme.title: WRT: 24 Hours of Le Mans and Spa
programme.desc: WRT stepped onto the global stage with two of the world’s most prestigious motorsport events. The team entered a formidable lineup at Le Mans, fielding four cars: two Hypercars and two GT3s, alongside five M4 GT3 Evos for the 24 Hours of Spa. Follow the team’s journey as they tackle these demanding races head-on.

programme.title: Rainer Schlegelmilch: Freezing Speed
programme.desc: In a Motorsport Network exclusive, this new film gives an incredible insight into the working life of Rainer Schlegelmilch, who is the only photographer to have been honoured with a lifetime F1 photographers accreditation.

programme.title: Porsche Cup Brasil 2025 | Round 5: Portimão - Endurance Race (EN) |
programme.desc: Watch the endurance race of the fifth round of the 2025 Porsche Carrera Cup Brasil season at Autódromo Internacional do Algarve.

programme.title: The 10 Best British F1 Drivers Of All Time
programme.desc: With the 70th Anniversary Grand Prix taking place at Silverstone this weekend, we thought we’d take a look at some of the greatest F1 drivers to ever come out of Great Britain.

programme.title: When Indycar Conquered F1 - Monzanapolis
programme.desc: Using the 2.6 mile oval circuit at Monza, Indycar and Formula 1 came together in the 1950's for an epic race showdown, but even with Ferrari and Jaguar leading the pack for the European teams, they were still outpaced by the Americans. In the latest episode in our “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner looks at when Indycar conquered F1.

programme.title: The Most Dominant Race Win In Modern F1
programme.desc: Winning margins in Formula 1 are usually measured in seconds. Occasionally, in a wet race, we get a race won by more than a minute. But sometimes we’ve needed another unit of measurement altogether. In the latest of Autosport’s “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner looks at when Damon Hill won by two laps…

programme.title: Gearing Up 2025 - Episode 9: Monster Jam & the TransAnatolia
programme.desc: Welcome to the ninth episode of Gearing Up for 2025! It’s the TV series that takes you around the globe, following the hottest action from some of the world’s most unique competitions. High skills, passion for technology, impatience for innovation, and pure love for adrenaline, are combined at their best. So, start your engines, tighten your seat belts, and get ready to feel the G-force with some serious action! From the raw horsepower and roaring crowds of Monster Jam, we dive into the endurance and grit of the TransAnatolia 2025, one of the most demanding cross-country rallies on the planet. The journey continues to Arendal, showcasing the Nordic spirit of motorsport where precision...

programme.title: 2024-2025 ALMS: Round 5 - 4 Hours of Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: Algarve Pro Racing dominated the first race in Abu Dhabi, securing a dramatic 1-2 finish after a thrilling final-lap overtake.

programme.title: Roaring To Victory - Jaguar
programme.desc: After an absence of almost three decades, Jaguar returned to top flight sportscar racing in 1985. This is the action-packed story of how the legendary British marque roared back to victory. Archive race footage traces the full story of how Tom Walkinshaw Racing took Jaguar to the top, claiming World Championship success and securing Jaguar's first victory at the Le Mans 24 Hours for 31 years. This film features highlights from the road to victory, from the debut of the XJR-6 at Canada's Mosport in August 1985 through to the 1988 Le Mans triumph of the XJR-9LM. You'll see the Tony Southgate-designed Jaguars in action at iconic circuits like Spa, Silverstone, Monza, Fuji and, of...

programme.title: Macau Grand Prix Part 1 1989
programme.desc: All of the action from the Macau Grand Prix in 1989, part 1 of 2.

programme.title: Macau Grand Prix Part 2 1989
programme.desc: All of the action from the Macau Grand Prix in 1989, part 2 of 2.

programme.title: Jenson Button Revisits His Biggest Racing Moments - F1, WEC, NASCAR and more
programme.desc: Jenson Button, current Hertz Team JOTA WEC driver and former F1 World Champion shares never-before-heard details on his wild 2009 title run with Brawn, his final F1 race in Monaco while subbing in for Fernando Alonso, the terrifying truth about his malfunctioning helmet in 2004, and more.

programme.title: Round 3 - Sonora Rally Prologue Highlights
programme.desc: Catch up on all the highlights from the 2023 Sonora Rally prologue

programme.title: Round 3 - Sonora Rally Stage 2 Highlights
programme.desc: It was all action during the second stage of the Sonora Rally. Stay tuned for all the news.

programme.title: Round 3 - Sonora Rally Stage 1 Highlights
programme.desc: Catch all the action from the first round of the Sonora Rally, round 3 of the World Rally-Raid Championship

programme.title: Round 3 - Sonora Rally Stage 3 Highlights
programme.desc: With Sebastian Loeb out after a crash that injured his co-driver, find out who leads the Sonora Rally.

programme.title: Round 3 - Sonora Rally Stage 4 Highlights
programme.desc: It was all action during the fourth stage of the Sonora Rally. Stay tuned for all the news.

programme.title: British GT 2025 | Round 8: Brands Hatch
programme.desc: Watch the eighth round of the 2025 British GT Championship at Brands Hatch.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Prologue
programme.desc: The BP Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal kicked off in Grândola with a 5 km prologue, marking the start of its second edition. Daniel Sanders (Red Bull KTM) claimed his 20th special win in RallyGP, while Edgar Canet (Rally2), Thomas Zoldos (Rally3), and Antanas Kanopkinas (quads) also took victories. FIA leader Nasser Al Attiyah (Dacia) repeated his 2024 prologue win ahead of Toyota’s Lucas Moraes and João Ferreira, while Carlos Sainz (Ford) finished last in class. Portuguese fans celebrated local triumphs from Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger) and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 1, a 425 km loop around Grândola, begins on Wednesday at 8:05 am (UTC+1).

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 1
programme.desc: Stage 1 of the bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal saw fierce battles on a 425 km loop around Grândola. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders (RallyGP) and Edgar Canet (Rally2) doubled up on their prologue wins, while Thomas Zoldos repeated in Rally3 and Gaëtan Martinez took the quad lead. In cars, Henk Lategan (Toyota) claimed the stage and overall lead ahead of four fellow Toyotas, as Nasser Al Attiyah (Dacia) slipped to eighth after a penalty. Mattias Ekström (Challenger) and Alexandre Pinto (SSV) also triumphed. Stage 2 heads into Spain with the week’s longest test: 655 km, including 429 against the clock.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 2
programme.desc: The bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal’s longest stage, a 655 km route from Grândola to Badajoz, delivered high drama on Thursday. Red Bull KTM’s Daniel Sanders edged Tosha Schareina in RallyGP, while teammate Edgar Canet extended his Rally2 lead. France’s Thomas Zoldos (Rally3) and Gaëtan Martinez (quads) dominated their classes, and João Ferreira (Toyota) claimed a breakthrough Ultimate win over mentor Carlos Sainz. Dacia endured setbacks as Nasser Al-Attiyah and Sébastien Loeb lost significant time. Portugal celebrated a historic triple in FIA categories with Ferreira, Gonçalo Guerreiro (Challenger), and Alexandre Pinto (SSV). Stage 3 will cover 511 km around Badajoz on Friday.

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 3
programme.desc: Yesterday in Badajoz, Daniel Sanders deprived Tosha Schareina of a coveted home win by just 4 seconds, but the Spaniard got his own back today, edging out the Australian at the end of a lengthy duel. "Chucky" fought gallantly despite having to open the course but had to yield near the finish. Schareina secured his first win since stage 5 of the Abu Dhabi Desert Challenge by 3′18″ and rocketed into the overall lead. The two favourites are now 1′42″ apart in the race for the trophy. "Chucky", who had remained undefeated since the start of the bp Ultimate Rally Raid Portugal, was reminded that all good things must come to an end. Tomorrow, he will set out to take back control from the new...

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 4
programme.desc: Tosha Schareina, the only man who had managed to beat Daniel Sanders this week, started the special with an overall lead of 1′42″. The Spaniard was leading the charge following his stage win yesterday, so he played it safe and managed to limit the damage to a 50-second deficit to the Australian 248 km into the 274 course. All that changed when he took the wrong turn a few minutes later, a blunder that came with a hefty price tag of 4′54″ lost to Sanders, who moved back into the hot seat. 3′12″ now separate "Chucky" and Schareina going into the finale, where the Spaniard faces an almost unsurmountable task. The man from Oz could be hours away from securing the RallyGP world championship....

programme.title: W2RC 2025: Rally Raid Portugal Stage 5
programme.desc: Daniel Sanders will forever be remembered as the first rider to claim the RallyGP title before the last event of the series. The Australian, who had been going from strength to strength in the three previous rounds, took it up to the fourth dimension in Lisbon. He crossed the finish line with 3′40″ to spare over runner-up Tosha Schareina (Monster Energy Honda HRC), who proved unable to defend his title. "Chucky", who nabbed four specials out of six, is the fourth rider to sit on the FIM throne in rally raids, following Sam Sunderland (2022), Luciano Benavides (2023) and Ross Branch (2024). His stats are out of this world, including records for the most RallyGP specials won in a single...

programme.title: ELMS 2024: Season review
programme.desc: Check out highlights from the 2024 European Le Mans Series.

programme.title: How This Troubled Car Drove F1's Greatest Qualifying Lap
programme.desc: From Senna to Schumacher to Hamilton, there are some great qualifiers in Formula 1, but who exactly has had the best qualifying lap in F1 history? In this episode of Autosport’s “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner picks out F1’s greatest qualifying laps.

programme.title: How Controversy at Imola Changed F1 Forever
programme.desc: Imola kicks off the European Formula 1 season in 2022 - the track has a rich history, but it’s also one filled with drama, controversy and tragedy – from intra-team fights to battles for the control of the sport and one of motorsport’s worst weekends. In the latest of our new "A Short View Back to the Past" series, Autosport's Chief Editor Kevin Turner takes a look at some of the most important moments in Imola’s rollercoaster story.

programme.title: The fastest F1 cars to never win a championship
programme.desc: Some cars obliterate the F1 field but once in a while, luck runs out and even the fastest cars and drivers can't win. In the latest of Autosport’s “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner reveals F1’s fastest failures.

programme.title: BRC 2025 - Round 7: A&D Omloop van Vlaanderen
programme.desc: Watch all of the action from round 7 of the Belgian Rally Championship, the A&D Rally Omloop van Vlaanderen.

programme.title: Life in Pictures: Mark Webber
programme.desc: Nine-time grand prix winner Mark Webber spent 12 years in Formula 1, most of them in the teeth of adversity: from wrestling with sub-optimal machinery at Minardi and Jaguar to providing adult supervision at a young Red Bull Racing, and a not always happy partnership with Sebastian Vettel. We take you through Webber’s early career and path to F1, from his arrival in the UK and Formula Ford in 1996, to joining up with Benetton and Flavio Briatore in 2001 and his transition to Jaguar and eventually Red Bull Racing. All photos used are taken from Motorsport Images, the largest collection of motorsport pictures in the world. (Warning, video contains some explicit language)

programme.title: Round 2: Posadas - Race 2
programme.desc: Watch the second race of the second round of the 2025 TCR South America season at Posadas, Argentina.

programme.title: Round 2: Hampton Downs Motorsport Park - Race 2
programme.desc: Watch the second race of the second round of the 2025 Castrol Toyota Formula Regional Championship season at Hampton Downs Motorsport Park, New Zealand.

programme.title: Never Just Win: The Making of a World Rally Champion
programme.desc: Never Just Win is a full-length documentary that looks back on the incredible 2024 World Rally Championship, which saw Thierry Neuville and Martijn Wydaeghe lift the Drivers' and Co-Drivers' titles in their Hyundai i20 N Rally1 Hybrid WRC car after an epic battle with their teammates Ott Tanak and Martin Jarveoja that went right to the final day of the season The film gives you exclusive behind-the-scenes access to the Hyundai Shell Mobis World Rally Team, featuring Esapekka Lappi and Janne Ferm, Andreas Mikkelsen and Torstein Eriksen, Dani Sordo and Cándido Carrera, Christian Loriaux, and Cyril Abiteboul, throughout one of the most dramatic and tense World Rally Championship seasons...

programme.title: Behind The Visor with Nico Hülkenberg
programme.desc: He may have taken 3 years out of full-time F1, but Nico Hülkenberg certainly hasn't lost the motivation to push himself. Earlier in the year, we caught up with the Hulk himself, where Nico opens up on his early retirement the first time around, his comeback with Haas and his future with Audi in F1. He also talks to GP Racing about his life, what drives him and what is really important outside of F1. For this interview, we partnered with our sister team GP Racing Magazine. Check out the link below to read the extended interview with Nico and more exclusive articles! www.gpracing.com

programme.title: IndyCar vs Formula 1 car: Technical Comparison
programme.desc: Which is faster: Lewis Hamilton's Formula 1 car, or Scott Dixon's Indycar? Both have had major success in their respective championships, but how different are the two machines? Using our latest 3D animations, Jake Boxall-Legge breaks down everything there is to compare Indycar and Formule 1 cars, from aerodynamics, power, tyres, fuel and more.

programme.title: How Formula 1 Setups Change For Downforce Vs Power Tracks
programme.desc: What makes a Formula 1 downforce track different to a power track? We've all heard the terms before, but different tracks require vastly different car setups to get the maximum advantage around a lap. But what are these requirements? Jake Boxall-Legge dives into why Imola, Monaco, Silverstone and Monza all require different changes to a car to succeed across the board.

programme.title: The banned Lotus that wasn't actually very good
programme.desc: The twin-chassis Lotus 88 is considered the last truly ground-breaking design attempted by Colin Chapman, but we never found out how fast it could have been because it was never allowed to race. However, as Giorgio Piola reveals, while rivals feared the concept, its drivers were not convinced the 88 would have delivered on the track. How did it work? Jake Boxall-Legge guides you through Chapman's complex idea to make ground effect cars more user-friendly.

programme.title: Everything You Need to Know About TYRES in Motorsport
programme.desc: Tyres play a vital role in getting the driver from A to B in a race. Here's the rundown of the variety of tyres and how they are used across different motorsports. programme.title: Round 2: Posadas - Race 1

programme.title: Tour Auto 2025
programme.desc: The Tour Auto 2025 came to an end after five days of emotion, performance and conviviality on France’s most beautiful roads. From Paris to Nice, this 34th edition brought together over 240 historic vehicles, offering a unique spectacle mixing motor sport, heritage and tradition. Setting off from the Château de Vaux-le-Vicomte in Paris on Tuesday April 8, the participants crossed exceptional landscapes and competed in timed events on circuits and closed roads. Thousands of spectators flocked to each stage, confirming the continuing enthusiasm for the event and its automotive heritage. From Paris to Nice, via Alsace and the Massif Central, each circuit and stopover town gave the...

programme.title: Giorgio Piola: Illustrating Speed
programme.desc: For nearly 50 years Giorgio Piola has been the foremost technical journalist in Formula 1. He has attended more Grands Prix than anyone in history. This film looks at the remarkable career of this legend.

programme.title: WRC takes on the Temple of Speed - Monza Rally Show
programme.desc: The World Rally Championship signed off 2024 in style with one last blast around the Temple of Speed as the Monza Rally Show returned after a brief hiatus, to celebrate the season just gone and the end of Pirelli's association with the WRC. New world champion Thierry Neuville reflects on his championship year while Autosport’s Tom Howard learns first hand what it takes to tackle Monza famous banking with Hyundai WRC driver Dani Sordo.

programme.title: BRX 2025: Rounds 4-5-6-7: Review
programme.desc: Take a look at the final four rounds of the 2025 Belgian Rallycross Championship.

programme.title: 2025 Belcar - Round 3: Spa-Francorchamps
programme.desc: Catch all the highlights from Spa-Francorchamps, the third round of the 2025 Belcar Endurance Championship.

programme.title: Nissan Skyline GTR
programme.desc: The original ‘beast from the east’, the Nissan Skyline GT-R is an icon for power, speed and advanced Japanese automotive technology. With straight-6 engines capable of being tuned to over 1000bhp, 4WD, intelligent torque-splitting differentials, rear-wheel steering and enough electronics to keep a space station going, the R-32, R-33 and R-34 models are mechanical ‘tour de forces’ .

programme.title: Le Mans Classic 2025
programme.desc: Step back in time at Le Mans Classic, where we meet legendary race drivers and passionate car collectors to explore the enduring legacy of vintage machines. From the roaring icons of 1923 to the sleek speedsters of the ’90s, experience the full spectrum of historic racing — on and off the track.

programme.title: Leclerc Looks Back at Highlights from his F1 Career
programme.desc: Charles Leclerc has had some huge moments in his career, from spectacular wins to helping the team develop even before he raced for Ferrari's F1 team. We sat down with Leclerc and brought him 5 photos from his career, asking him to pinpoint where he was and why each photo is so special to him.

programme.title: Life in Pictures: Mark Webber
programme.desc: Nine-time grand prix winner Mark Webber spent 12 years in Formula 1, most of them in the teeth of adversity: from wrestling with sub-optimal machinery at Minardi and Jaguar to providing adult supervision at a young Red Bull Racing, and a not always happy partnership with Sebastian Vettel. We take you through Webber’s early career and path to F1, from his arrival in the UK and Formula Ford in 1996, to joining up with Benetton and Flavio Briatore in 2001 and his transition to Jaguar and eventually Red Bull Racing. All photos used are taken from Motorsport Images, the largest collection of motorsport pictures in the world. (Warning, video contains some explicit language)

programme.title: What it Takes to be an F1 World Champion - Exclusive Interview with Damon Hill
programme.desc: Joining James Allen on the podcast this week is Damon Hill, 1996 F1 World Champion and broadcaster, whilst he trains for his Neuro UK Fundraiser, cycling the 2024 L'Etape du Tour event in France. The pair discuss everything from the upcoming 2024 Silverstone Grand Prix, what it's like for British drivers to win their home race, engaging with F1's fanbase and what it takes to become an F1 World Champion. programme.title: The Valentino Rossi Story
programme.desc: An extraordinary personality, global popularity, legendary victory celebrations, and nine motorcycle world championship titles - those are the words to describe Valentino Rossi.

programme.title: The Top 10 Red Bull F1 Drivers - Part 1
programme.desc: Red Bull is much younger than Formula 1’s other big teams, having arrived in 2005. But in less than two decades it has racked up some impressive achievements. Six drivers’ and five constructors’ titles headline a CV that includes 92 world championship grand prix wins, enough for sixth on the all-time list behind Ferrari, McLaren, Mercedes, Williams and Lotus. For this list of top 10 F1 drivers, we’ve taken into account the amount of success the racers scored with Red Bull and its sister team Toro Rosso/AlphaTauri, the impact they had and the circumstances of their time within the Red Bull fold. Want to know more about our top 10 or hear experts debate the list? Take a look here: ...

programme.title: The Top 10 Red Bull F1 Drivers - Part 2
programme.desc: Red Bull is much younger than Formula 1’s other big teams, having arrived in 2005. But in less than two decades it has racked up some impressive achievements. Six drivers’ and five constructors’ titles headline a CV that includes 92 world championship grand prix wins, enough for sixth on the all-time list behind Ferrari, McLaren, Mercedes, Williams and Lotus. Want to know more about our top 10 or hear experts debate the list? Take a look here: ...

programme.title: 4 Things We'd Change To Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya | Formula 1
programme.desc: How do you fix the Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya? Was the new Turn 10 any better? And is it a completely boring circuit? Spanish GP races are usually a snoozefest, and despite Mercedes' exciting strategic win, the 2021 GP wasn't much better. But why is that? Jake Boxall-Legge has 4 ways the circuit could improve, whether the new Turn 10 saved the day, and how Formula 1 drivers could benefit from circuit upgrades.

programme.title: The banned Lotus that wasn't actually very good
programme.desc: The twin-chassis Lotus 88 is considered the last truly ground-breaking design attempted by Colin Chapman, but we never found out how fast it could have been because it was never allowed to race. However, as Giorgio Piola reveals, while rivals feared the concept, its drivers were not convinced the 88 would have delivered on the track. How did it work? Jake Boxall-Legge guides you through Chapman's complex idea to make ground effect cars more user-friendly.

programme.title: 8 F1 drivers who only started one grand prix
programme.desc: Drivers only making one Formula 1 start in their career are a rare breed, and quite often those who appear just once have an interesting story behind their fleeting presence on the F1 grid. Jake Boxall-Legge takes a look back through history to pick out eight varied stories about one-time F1 starters - some you may remember better than others. And we finish off our trip down memory lane paying our respects to a man who only made this list because tragedy intervened...

programme.title: British GT 2025 | Round 7: Snetterton
programme.desc: Watch the seventh round of the 2025 British GT Championship at Snetterton.

programme.title: 2025 Hail International Rally - Full Review
programme.desc: All the highlights from the 2025 Hail International Rally in Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: MLMC 2024: Season review
programme.desc: Check out highlights from the 2024 Michelin Le Mans Cup.

programme.title: ELMS 2024: Season review
programme.desc: Check out highlights from the 2024 European Le Mans Series.

programme.title: San Remo Rally 1985
programme.desc: The Lancias made a welcome comeback and added colour to an event, which turned out more a test of stamina than predicted. Walter Rohrl can be seen hurling the big Quattro through the mountains. On the gravel or tarmac, San Remo belonged to Walter Rohrl.

programme.title: Why the 'second' Niki Lauda was even better than the first
programme.desc: As the Formula 1 paddock sets up in Monaco, the late Niki Lauda is not far from anyone's thoughts following his death earlier this week. Inside the paddock, Edd Straw is joined by Giorgio Piola, who knew Lauda throughout his F1 career, to get a very personal account of what it was like to know the three-time world champion. Piola explains what made Lauda tick, and how his accident in 1976 changed him into a new person who was "even more wonderful than the first".

programme.title: 9 interesting F1 tests that didn’t lead to anything
programme.desc: Formula 1 testing has thrown up some interesting car and driver combinations over the years, and as this list shows, plenty of top-name drivers have turned up in unexpected places. But sometimes a test deal catches the eye then doesn’t lead to a more permanent arrangement, for a wide variety of reasons. Here we take a look at nine particularly high-profile drivers who had a brief try-out with a team, but didn’t end up signing a proper deal

programme.title: The Best Looking F1 Cars Of All Time
programme.desc: It's a debate as old as Formula 1 itself - which F1 car is the best looking? Throughout the last 70 years we've seen some real beauties, as well as some cars we'd rather we hadn't... but this time we're focussing on the top 10 cars we'll never get tired of looking at, ranging from more recent modern icons all the way back to the classics in the 50s. Thanks to Duke Archives for footage from their documentary "If You're Not Winning... You're Not Trying", following the Lotus team behind the scenes in 1973 as they win the Constructors Championship. To see more of this, check out the full documentary here:...

programme.title: The history of driver bans in Formula 1
programme.desc: Formula 1 drivers very rarely get banned from races - in fact, just five times in the history of the world championship has a driver sat out a race due to an official FIA sanction. But, unsurprisingly, F1's history of bans is a bit more complicated than that, so in this video we also look at the other drivers who have served what could be termed as 'unofficial' bans over the course of F1 history.

programme.title: Gearing Up 2025 - Episode 8: The Baja España Aragón
programme.desc: Welcome to the eighth episode of Gearing Up for 2025! It’s the TV series that takes you around the globe, following the hottest action from some of the world’s most unique competitions. High skills, passion for technology, impatience for innovation, and pure love for adrenaline, are combined at their best. So, start your engines, tighten your seat belts, and get ready to feel the G-force with some serious action! We start in Europe at the Baja España Aragón, where over 160 teams compete across cars, bikes, quads, and trucks. Lorenzo Santolino and Jao Ferreira dominate the motorcycle and car categories, while Martin Maciek showcases the raw power of trucks in a thrilling...

programme.title: 2024-2025 ALMS: Round 5 - 4 Hours of Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: Algarve Pro Racing dominated the first race in Abu Dhabi, securing a dramatic 1-2 finish after a thrilling final-lap overtake.

programme.title: 71st Macau GP: FR Macau Grand Prix - FIA FR World Cup - Race
programme.desc: Watch the livestream of the 71st Macau Grand Prix FR Macau Grand Prix 15 lap race as it happens.

programme.title: Motorsport Images: An Enduring Legacy
programme.desc: 26 million images. 100 years of racing. This is the story of Motorsport Images, the premiere photographic agency and archive covering motorsport and motoring. It is unique in that it provides photography of all major current motorsport events, from Formula One Grand Prix racing to national level racing, as well as archive images documenting the history of the sport dating back to 1895.

programme.title: Jenson Button Revisits His Biggest Racing Moments - F1, WEC, NASCAR and more
programme.desc: Jenson Button, current Hertz Team JOTA WEC driver and former F1 World Champion shares never-before-heard details on his wild 2009 title run with Brawn, his final F1 race in Monaco while subbing in for Fernando Alonso, the terrifying truth about his malfunctioning helmet in 2004, and more.

programme.title: Seven ways F1 teams covered up tobacco advertising
programme.desc: Ferrari and McLaren both changed branding on their cars for the Australian Grand Prix, due to complaints about their links to tobacco companies. That brought back memories of when several teams on the grid carried full-on tobacco sponsorship, and they would have to change their liveries when racing in countries where cigarette sponsorship was outlawed. In this video we take a look back at seven popular methods that were used by teams during this period.

programme.title: Nine times F1 drivers lost maiden victories
programme.desc: Charles Leclerc’s heartbreaking lost victory in the Bahrain Grand Prix brought back memories of other times in Formula 1 history that drivers missed out on a maiden win. In this list we take a look at some of the most painful of those stories, and the variety of reasons that robbed drivers of their first chance to stand on the top step of an F1 podium.

programme.title: Five moments that shaped F1's first 1000 races
programme.desc: Formula 1 celebrates the 1000th world championship race this weekend in China, and to kick off the festivities we're looking back at races from its history that have defined the way F1 has changed over the years. Join Edd Straw and Stuart Codling from the paddock in Shanghai to take a journey through some of the most important moments that have got us to the 1000th race

programme.title: Top 10 Senna Moments
programme.desc: Qualifying performances from "another dimension"; thrashing his rivals repeatedly in torrential wet conditions; doing whatever it took to win the world championship at all costs. Ayrton Senna's too-brief time in Formula 1 was a colourful tapestry of brilliant driving and high-stakes controversy. On the 25th anniversary of his tragic crash at Imola, Autosport brings you the most unforgettable moments of the late Brazilian's F1 career.

programme.title: Roaring To Victory - Jaguar
programme.desc: After an absence of almost three decades, Jaguar returned to top flight sportscar racing in 1985. This is the action-packed story of how the legendary British marque roared back to victory. Archive race footage traces the full story of how Tom Walkinshaw Racing took Jaguar to the top, claiming World Championship success and securing Jaguar's first victory at the Le Mans 24 Hours for 31 years. This film features highlights from the road to victory, from the debut of the XJR-6 at Canada's Mosport in August 1985 through to the 1988 Le Mans triumph of the XJR-9LM. You'll see the Tony Southgate-designed Jaguars in action at iconic circuits like Spa, Silverstone, Monza, Fuji and, of...

programme.title: Round 1: Taupo International Motorsport Park - Race 1
programme.desc: Watch the first race of the first round of the 2024 Castrol Toyota Formula Regional Oceania Championship at Taupo International Motorsport Park, New Zealand.

programme.title: It's Time To Get Excited About Hydrogen Powered Race Cars
programme.desc: Hydrogen power is developing at a breakneck speed, and for Motorsport development, AVL is leading the charge. We visited AVL's headquarters in Graz, Austria, to find out just how they're developing a Hydrogen powered race car, and how it compares to the real thing in their state-of-the-art simulator. Thanks to AVL for providing access to their HQ and for sponsoring this video!

programme.title: BACK TO NORMAL
programme.desc: For Ian Mitchard jumping out of airplanes and soaring above the earth with a nylon canopy is as normal as walking through the grocery store. But when a dramatic accident put the lifestyle he loves in jeopardy, Ian is forced to grapple with his body.

programme.title: Chasing Dreams -Episode 5

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 2, Germany
programme.desc: The second stage of Strongman champions league will be hosted in Germany, by FIBO - the leading international trade show for fitness, wellness and health worldwide with 300,000 visitors in four days. Special implements like the biggest log in the world or the special Bavarian stone lift are not only a challenge, but also an opportunity for new personal, national and world records.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 3, Holland
programme.desc: Holland is hosting 12 different countries with 14 of the strongest men in the world for the third stage of the Strongman Champions League.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 4, Finland
programme.desc: Zydrunas Savickas, one of strongest people on earth is in this competition which has attracted the attention of the audience in the battle for the title of strongest man in Finland. The next round of SCL is in Bulgaria.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 5, Bulgaria
programme.desc: The next stage of the competition is in Bulgaria where Ervin Katona (SCL World Champion 2012) will compete for the last time.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 6, Latvia
programme.desc: Krzysztof Radzikowski, the leader in the league will fight hard to keep Dainis Zageris off from the title and to gather another 25 ranking points in this next stage in Latvia.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 7, Croatia
programme.desc: The competition sees a close battle with a new world record in overhead dumbbell and close finishes throughout the day. This stage is in Croatia, in a city over 1700 years old, steeped in Roman tradition and history, the athletes arrive for the truck pull after a picturesque boat ride on the Adriatic Sea.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E08 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 8, Poland
programme.desc: We are now half way through the SCL 2015 and getting closer to the grand world finals in Turkey. The eighth stage is in Poland, the home country of the current leader Krzysztof Radzikowski.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 9, Austria
programme.desc: In this stage we go into the mountains of Austria to find out through six grueling events who is the strongest in the land of Alps. Martin Wildauer, current World Champion 2014 and Austrian local is competing alongside Zageris, Radzikowski, Belsak and many others.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E10 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 10, Romania
programme.desc: The 10th stage of this year's competition in Strongman Champions League is held in the Romanian city of Sibiu where the 12 strongmen continue to compete for the title.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E11 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 11, World Log Lift Championship
programme.desc: The 11th stage is the SCL Log Lift World Championships in Lithuania. In this championship, each competitor must lift three different weights overhead. Zydrunas Savickas is the current world record holder in the Log Lift.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E12 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 12, Lithuania
programme.desc: This next episode of the Strongman Champions League is hosted in Lithuania and sees us getting one step closer to the final.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E13 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 13, Portugal
programme.desc: The 13th stage of Strongman Champions League is in Maia, Portugal. The competition is at the “Powerexpo” – one of the best sport and fitness events in Portugal.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E14 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 14, Martinique
programme.desc: This stage is in Martinique and eight strongmen from all over the world will compete for the last chance to gather points before the world grand finals in December.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E15 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 15, Lightweight World Championship
programme.desc: A special World championship under the newcomers and lightweights in the Strongman world. Some of them will step from this to the heavyweights divisions.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S02 : E16 SCL 2015 Season 2, Episode 16, World Finals Turkey
programme.desc: After 15 outstanding competitions all over the world, finally we are here at the final competition of this year’s Strongman Champions League hosted in Turkey.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E01 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 1, Norway - World strongest Viking
programme.desc: Welcome to the land of Vikings - Norway - to the first stage of the SCL World Series 2016

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 2, Germany
programme.desc: The second stage of the SCL heads to the FIBO convention, Cologne. The leading international trade show for fitness, wellness and health hosts.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 3, Lithuania - Log lift World championship
programme.desc: For the third stage of SCL world series 2016, the athletes compete in Kaunas for the SCL Log Lift World Championships.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 4, Holland
programme.desc: Stage four is an epic competition and a few surprises. With 14 strongmen from all over the world, one newcomer left quite an impression.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 5, Latvia
programme.desc: This year Lauri Nami joins the starting list, back after last year's injury in Romania

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 6, Serbia
programme.desc: The SCL train stopped in Zlatibor for the stage 6 of the MLO SCL. 11 compete for the title in the home country of legendary Ervin Katona.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 7, Bulgaria
programme.desc: Bulgaria hosts the next stage of the SCL. Current leader in the World Series is Matjaz Belsak, youngest competitor and strongest man of Slovenia.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E08 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 8, England
programme.desc: The competitors battle it out in the special event, the Atlas Steel Stone. This stone is made completely from iron and cannot be touched with any support.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E09 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 9, Finland
programme.desc: This stage sees the strongmen visit Vaasa, Finland. Residents here are familiar with the competition because some of the SCL icons are from their country.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E10 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 10, Finland - World championship under 105 kilograms
programme.desc: 38 athletes compete in the under 90kg and under 105kg SCL World Championships. From each weight class, the top 12 qualify for the finals.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E11 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 11, Romania Part 1
programme.desc: A two day, seven event battle with lots of spectators.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E12 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 12, Romania Part 2
programme.desc: Alex Moonen is leading. Part two of the competition in Romania showcases a new challenge - Hercules Hold.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E13 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 13, Curacao
programme.desc: In this stage in Curacao no one wants to lose the chance to fight for one kilo gold in World grand finals in Dubai.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E14 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 14, Portugal
programme.desc: The last chance to qualify for the World Grand Finale. Zageris and Belsak fight for the better position for the finals.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E15 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 15, Dubai World grand finals (Part 1)
programme.desc: We reach Dubai where we will crown the new champion for SCL 2016. This is part one of the world finals.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S03 : E16 SCL 2016 Season 3, Episode 16, Dubai World grand finals (Part 2)
programme.desc: In this last episode, the best athletes compete in Pole Push, Deadlift, Forward Hold and Loading.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E01 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 1, Norway
programme.desc: We are in beautiful Norway for the kick off of the 2017 MLO Strongman Champions League season. With partly cloudy weather and lots of snow, we have the perfect scenery for the athletes, who prepare for the first contest of the year.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E03 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 3, Lithuania
programme.desc: This weekend sees the Strongman Champions League Log Lift World Championships in Lithuania. Big lifting names such as Graham Hicks , Vidas Blekaitis and Vytatus Lalas are in the startlist to push some big numbers.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E02 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 2, Germany
programme.desc: A definite highlight in this FIBO edition in Germany, Strongman Champions League introduced its new rules for a special team item. Graham Hicks tries here to set a New World Record on the biggest log in the world, currently held by Krzysztof Radzikowski. Boosted also by the presence of the acclaimed in the strongman circles names of Mark Felix and Danis Zageris.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E04 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 4, Holland
programme.desc: The battle of the Dutch will take place this edition in Lichtenvoorde, a place very well known in Holland because of the famous “Black Cross”. The athletes will compete over six heavy events and the winner gets 25 Strongman Champions League ranking points.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E05 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 5, Serbia
programme.desc: Set in the beautiful mountain resort Zlatibor, the fifth stage of the Strongman Champions League 2017 sees 14 athletes from across the world competing for the gold medal of SCL Serbia 2017. The event welcomes top-athlete - and odds-on favourite - Matjaz Belsak (Slovenia), who has presented himself in an impressive shape so far. Can his opponents defeat him?

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E06 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 6, Canada (Part 1)
programme.desc: The next two stages take place in Quebec. With eight events over two days, SCL Canada is a true ‘heavyweight’. The athletes compete in: Truck Pull, Deadlift with cars, Log Lift, and the Atlas Stones. The World’s Strongest Viking Jean-Francois Caron from Canada is a favourite, as well as current SCL leader Matjaz Belsak (Slovenia) and promising underdog Jimmy Paquet (Canada).

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E07 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 7, Canada (Part 2)
programme.desc: Welcome to the second day in Quebec. The athletes are fighting hard to win this two-day event. The last points of this SCL stage can be won over four outstanding disciplines: Power Stairs, Dumbbell Press, Keg Toss, and finally, the legendary Farmer’s Walk. Who will leave Canada with the yellow ‘Leader Shirt’?

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E09 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 9, Finland (Part 2)
programme.desc: The fight for the Finnish trophy continues. In this unmissable SCL event, the strongmen battle for the win in the Carry and Drag, the Forward Hold, Deadlifting with Cars and the Loading Race. Belsak, Radzikowski and Zageris look good after the first day, but the others haven’t given up yet.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E08 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 8, Finland (Part 1)
programme.desc: Stages 8 and 9 of the SCL are hosted in Vaasa, Finland, taking place over a spectacular two-day event. After 3 wins so far, Matjaz Belsak from Slovenia plans to extend his lead at the top of the table. Among the other 13 highly motivated strongmen, two SCL legends will make their comeback to the competition: Former World Champion of 2015, Krzysztof Radzikowski (Poland) and Dainis Zageris (Latvia).

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E10 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 10, Finland Lightweight World Championship
programme.desc: This under 105kg category event is the ultimate preparation for up-and-coming strongman athletes before entering the heavy class. The Lightweight World Championship is a special every year in the SCL calendar as it sees new talents rise and many promising athletes who are gearing up for future tournaments. A total of 25 athletes from 16 different countries make their way to Kokkola, Finland

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E11 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 11, Romania
programme.desc: Situated in the very heart of the Carpathian Mountains, Sibiu is a Romanian town where the climate is pleasantly mild, offering some of the best weather conditions for a strongman event around Europe. All this, without doubt, set the mood for the high results and showtime vibes in Stage 11 of Strongman Champions League. The competition in Sibiu was organized in six different disciplines

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E12 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 12, Curacao
programme.desc: From now on every stage of these series will be more than crucial. Curacao is a beautiful Dutch island in the Caribbean, with a great atmosphere to hold another stage of the MLO Strongman Champions League. Let’s see who takes the title here and who will secure a place in the next stage.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E13 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 13, Jordan
programme.desc: Ten of the world’s strongest men gathered in Amman to compete in Jordan’s first-ever Truck-Pull Championship. The contestants race against the clock while pulling a 21-ton truck across the track. One of the most fierce competitors to take part in the event was four-time winner of the World’s Strongest Man competition, Brian Shaw.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E14 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 14, Greece
programme.desc: Taking place in Corinth, Greece, considered by many the cradle of the sports competition games, an epic strongman battle will mark the last stage before the upcoming big two-day season’s finale in Chetumal, Mexico. In front of more than 5000 spectators, the twelve athletes compete in Log Lifts, Card Deadlift, Conan’s Wheel and Loading.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E15 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 15, Mexico World Finals (Part 1)
programme.desc: The first day of the two-part finale sees the strongest men competing in Carry and Drag, Dumbbell Lift and the Truck Pull. Everything is possible in this heated fight for the crown against the backdrop of stunning Chetumal, Mexico.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S04 : E16 SCL 2017 Season 4, Episode 16, Mexico World Finals (Part 2)
programme.desc: On the second day of the grand finale of the 2017 Strongman Champions League, the athletes have a last chance to secure the medals in the spectacular four events Weight for Height, Deadlift Cars, Forward Hold and The Loading Medley. Be prepared for stunning performances – and even world records!

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E01 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 1, Norway - World Strongest Viking
programme.desc: Season 2018 begins with 14 strongest men in the world, all competing for the title. The competition kicks off in Norway. We’ll see typical Viking disciplines, team events and world records in heavy conditions in the land of snow and ice. They will suffer, they will freeze and fight in this first competition of the year for the title that they will carry on their shoulders throughout whole year.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E02 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 2, Germany - FIBO Power
programme.desc: The next stop in strongest league of the world is muscle capital, largest number of strong shoulders per capichampions league on the planet. It’s a FIBO - the biggest expo on planet Earth and the second stage of 2018 Strongman champions league, in Cologne, Germany.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E03 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 3, Abu Dhabi
programme.desc: For the first time in history, Strongman Champions League will set up competition in Abu Dhabi. The line-up of super athletes, who are part of the SCL, includes former world champions Dainis Zageris (Latvia) & Krzysztof Radzikowski (Poland), current world champion Matjaz Belsak (Slovenia) and biggest strongman in the World Sean O’Hagan (Ireland).

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E04 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 4, Holland (Part 1)
programme.desc: Strongman classic in land where there is no place for anything else excepts strength, fight and endurance. Here are fourteen of the strongest men, fighting for the title of strongest in Holland.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E05 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 5, Holland (Part 2)
programme.desc: We go back to Holland, where former champion Dainis Zageris is in leading position after the first three events. Alongside Radzikowski, he is in this moment favorite for world title, and also leader shirt holder.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E06 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 6, Finland
programme.desc: Stage six of Strongman champions league, 2018 is set back on north, in Finland. Here we have Matjaz Belsak, wearing SCL leader shirt, one of the biggest strongman in the World Mika Torro, fan favorite strongman in all over the World – Will Baggott, and also big name from Baltic – Aivars Smaukstelis

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E07 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 7, Serbia
programme.desc: Twelve strongman, including defending Worldchampion Matjaz Belsak from Slovenia , will compete on “Air spa” for the title of best in homeland country of Tesla, Pupin, Novak Djokovic. Matjaz Belsak is the SCL leader in this competition, chasing his third victory this season.

programme.title: Strongman Champions League
programme.sub-title: S05 : E08 SCL 2018 Season 5, Episode 8, Finland - U105 (Part 1)
programme.desc: The World championship in lightweights of the Strongman Champions League bring to us 50 strongmen from all over the world. All athletes are under 105 kilograms and for them this is the step up to the ultimate heavyweights.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: Headlining the event is the highly anticipated trilogy fight between kickboxing legends Badr Hari and Alistair Overeem. In a bout over a decade in the making, Hari and Overeem will end their rivalry on the biggest stage in the sport after splitting first round knockouts with each other during the late 2000s.

programme.title: GLORY Kickboxing
programme.desc: The event will be headlined by an exhilarating heavyweight matchup between No. 1 ranked contender Antonio Plazibat and No. 10 ranked contender Raul Catinas. Also featured on the card, MMA veteran Joilton Lutterbach will make his GLORY debut against fellow debutant Mark Trijsburg in a welterweight bout. Top-five lightweight contender Itay Gershon will make his return to the GLORY ring against promotional newcomer Cihad Akipa.
